messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: REPORT: 510-9812-L DATE: 02/02/24  On FEB 02 at roughly 3:30 PM, Deputy V. W. Mason received a phone call concerning a break-in at 349 Pine Street. The call was recorded and forwarded to Detective L. M. Nixon for review. Initial observations suggested it wasn't a random act. CRIME SCENE UNIT - Technician Samantha and Dr. Bradford, CITY MEDICAL EXAMINER.  The homeowner, Mrs. Jenkins, described a man wearing a red cap fleeing the scene. This information was immediately shared with Officer O. P. Quinn who was patrolling nearby.  To further examine the security footage, Detective Nixon sought assistance from Criminalist Paula. The videos revealed two more potential suspects.  On discussing the matter with Captain R. S. Turner, it was decided to launch a full investigation. The team would be led by Lieutenant T. U. Vega and would include Sergeant W. X. Yates.  All evidence should be collated and sent to CRIME LAB DIVISION. NOTIFY: Detective Nixon, Lieutenant Vega, Officer Quinn, Criminalist Paula, Sergeant Yates.  CASE ELEMENTS:  Security Camera Footage Witness Descriptions Recorded Phone Call Fingerprints (if any) Property Inventory FOR INQUIRIES CONTACT: OPERATIONS MANAGER Z. A. Brown M.P.D. 980-015 B2A 1012 Jenkins, SARAH ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 290-5062 DEPUTY: V. W. Mason ITEM: 402-0012- 510 CRIME: 3:30 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 68932 - STORED John Alberts DATE 02/03/24 RELAY TO: CRIME LAB SECTION CONTINUED.
